messages.content:
Du er en salgsintelligens-ekspert for Sonat Consulting, et norsk konsulentselskap som spesialiserer seg på business intelligence og salgsmuligheter for teknologi- og vekstbedrifter.

SONAT FOKUS: 
- Identifisere bedrifter i bevegelse (funding, vekst, ekspansjon, partnerskap)
- Norske og nordiske teknologiselskaper med >10 ansatte
- Bedrifter som trenger konsulentbistand innen digital transformasjon
- Salgsmuligheter innen AI, data analytics, og forretningsutvikling

KONVERTER RSS-data til JSON-object med følgende struktur:

KRITISKE KRAV:
1. Returner BARE valid JSON object - ingen forklarende tekst
2. Vurder hver artikkel mot Sonat's ICP (Ideal Customer Profile)
3. Fokuser på norske/nordiske bedrifter og business events
4. Scorer relevans basert på salgspotensial for Sonat

JSON OBJECT FORMAT (OBLIGATORISK):
{
  "data": [
    {
      "Kilde": "Mediekilde (string)",
      "Dato": "YYYY-MM-DD format (string)",
      "Tittel": "Artikkelens tittel (string)",
      "Sammendrag": "en god og detaljerik oppsummering, 150-300 ord (string)",
      "URL": "Direktelenke (string)",
      "Forfatter": "Forfatter eller 'Ikke oppgitt' (string)",
      "Kategori": "Finans|Teknologi|Business|M&A|Funding|Ekspansjon|Diverse (string)",
      "Relevans_Score": "1-10 basert på Sonat salgspotensial (integer)",
      "AI_Tags": ["2-4 relevante tags på norsk (array)"],
      "Status": "Ny (string)",
      "Opprettet": "Dagens dato YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (string)"
    }
  ]
}

SONAT RELEVANS_SCORE KRITERIER:
🔥 9-10 (HØYPRIORITET - Hot Leads):
- Kapitalinnhenting/funding runder for tech-selskaper
- Oppkjøp/M&A aktivitet
- Store teknologikontrakter/partnerskap
- Børsnotlering/exit events
- Store ekspansjonsplaner

⚡ 7-8 (MEDIUM PRIORITET - Warm Leads):
- Nye ledere/CTO/CDO utnevnelser
- Digitale transformasjonsprosjekter
- AI/data analytics implementeringer
- Vekstfinansiering/investeringsrunder
- Teknologiselskaper med vekstutfordringer

📊 5-6 (OVERVÅKING - Watch List):
- Generell bedriftsvekst
- Mindre partnerskap/samarbeid
- Produktlanseringer
- Bransjeutviklinger som påvirker tech-sektoren

❌ 1-4 (LAV PRIORITET):
- Generelle nyheter uten business-impact
- Sport, underholdning, politikk (uten tech-vinkling)
- Selskaper under 10 ansatte
- Utenlandske selskaper uten nordisk tilknytning

SPESIELLE NØKKELORD SOM ØKER SCORE:
+2 poeng: "funding", "kapital", "investering", "oppkjøp", "børs"
+1 poeng: "AI", "digitalisering", "teknologi", "vekst", "ekspansjon"
+1 poeng: "Norge", "nordisk", "skandinavisk"
-2 poeng: "konkurs", "nedleggelse", "tap"

EKSEMPEL OUTPUT:
{
  "data": [
    {
      "Kilde": "Finansavisen",
      "Dato": "2025-06-05",
      "Tittel": "TechCorp henter 30 millioner i serie A",
      "Sammendrag": "Oslo-baserte TechCorp hentet 30M kr fra Nordic Capital for AI-plattform ekspansjon.",
      "URL": "https://finansavisen.no/techcorp-funding",
      "Forfatter": "Lars Hansen",
      "Kategori": "Funding",
      "Relevans_Score": 10,
      "AI_Tags": ["funding", "AI-teknologi", "ekspansjon"],
      "Status": "Ny",
      "Opprettet": "2025-06-05 14:30:00"
    }
  ]
}

RETURNER KUN VALID JSON OBJECT MED "data" PROPERTY - INGEN ANNEN TEKST!

fields.name: Bedrift
fields.description:
Hent ut den relevante bedriften i dette sammendraget fra en sak i {{11.result.data[].Kilde}} som kom ut {{11.result.data[].Dato}}.  Navnet skal i etterkant brukes til å søke i proff.no etter bedriften sin info så det er viktig at det er riktig. 
den relevante tittel er: {{11.result.data[].Tittel}}

mapper.html:
The most notable Norwegian tech stories from the past two weeks
View this email in your browser
I work at Sondo Capital, investing in startups at pre-seed and seed stage. This is a newsletter of what I've found most noteworthy in Norwegian tech the past two weeks. Feel free to forward this email to someone you believe will like it. If it's been forwarded to you, click here to subscribe. /Kjetil

Funding news: 
Cartesian, thermal energy storage technology, has raised 30MNOK from Såkorn 1 Midt, Ystvika Holding, and Devico Invest. Link

BlinkTroll, moving targets for soldier training, has raised €1.5M from Final Frontier and others. Link

Legal platform Lexolve has raised 10MNOK from Jostein Håvaldsrud, Are Meisfjord, Thomas Falck, Kjetil Solvik Olsen, and others.  Link

Process management software Namuda has raised 2.2MNOK from Varde Investeringslaug. Link

Farmforce, software for tracking food's "first mile", has raised an undisclosed amount in a round led by Edaphon. Link

E-sport companies Good Game and Skagerrak Technologies are merging. Link

Impact Startup will start investing 1MNOK in each company participating in their program. Also notable is that participating companies have the option to repay the investment if they don't raise further external financing within three years after the program. Not all companies should go down the venture route, and this is a great way to accommodate for this (similar to what Indie. VC has done in the US). Link

Other notable stories:
TotalCtrl-founder Charlotte Aschim talks about unwanted sexual approaches from investors when building her company. Extremely unfortunate, and while I wish I could say this is the first time I've heard such a story, that is unfortunately not the case. There are way too few female founders, and stories like this don't help at all. Link

Jon Kåre Stene on the "Attacking Vikings" principles for the Norwegian startup scene. And ref the previous post, see principle 1: no jerks (should be) allowed. Link

Founders in Oslo can no longer apply for Innovation Norway's Oppstartstilskudd 1 grant, as they are out of money for the year. You're much more likely to become a professional hockey player if you're born earlier in the year, and perhaps soon we'll see the same for Norwegian startups? Jokes aside, this is yet another argument for decentralizing incentives for early-stage money. As mentioned several times before, I believe significantly increased tax incentives for angel investors would be an extremely efficient - and decentralized - way to fund more founders early on. Link

The government has granted six research centres a total of 1.2BNOK over the next 5 years. Link

Interview with Sten Kirkbak, the founder of kids' smartwatch Xplora. Well-deserved recognition of a company doing quite well without getting that much attention in the tech press. Link

DN with an extensive, negative story on Norwegian private equity. The story discusses how the IRR (internal rate of return) is an imperfect measure of performance, but fails to highlight that no_private_equity_manager_ever presents only that number. Instead, they typically present a multitude of numbers, the numbers that professional institutional investors request when deciding whether to invest or not. 

It's a fascinating yet predictable story, but what I find even more fascinating is how the story fails to address the underlying problem: that all these companies actively choose to remain private, rather than listing on stock exchanges. And it's not a Nordic problem: global companies like Stripe and SpaceX also prefer to stay private. Companies chose this path for various reasons: reduced noise (no live stock prices), reduced reporting and compliance, and ironically, to avoid undeserved media scrutiny. As a consequence, the only way pension funds (and indirectly, retail investors) get access to these companies is through expensive private market funds (2/20 fees).

Instead of painting private equity as the villain, maybe also ask why companies and fund investors alike prefer it to the public markets. Everyone would benefit from more companies going public, but we probably have to rethink what it means to be a publicly listed company for that to happen. For more on the topic, see Joachim Høegh-Krohn's comment on LinkedIn, and also the Bill Gurley podcast in the next section. Link

Some revenue numbers:
Electricity company Tibber: 5820MNOK, online learning platform Kahoot: 1050MNOK, HR platform Simployer: 615.4MNOK, enterprise architecture company Ardoq: 339MNOK, second-hand fashion app Tise: 190.7MNOK, health monitoring sensor company Vitalthings: 17.7MNOK, property management software Propely: 16.3MNOK

From abroad: 
I've really enjoyed this four-part podcast with Silicon Valley insider Ron Conway. Conway has been involved in many of the most important tech companies built over the past 30 years (if you don't know who he is, see this explainer from Ben Horowitz), and in this podcast, he shares selected stories from that work. Also very evident through the podcast is the incredible connectedness of Silicon Valley: people meet at kids' baseball practices, parties, or wherever. Without a doubt, one of the unfair advantages people in the Bay Area have. Links: part one, two, three, four

Thread of "hilariously wrong tech predictions". It's easy to grin at these takes, but important to remember that early-stage investing is all about avoiding mistakes of omission, not mistakes of commission. You only risk losing 1x your money when investing (commission), but if you pass on the wrong opportunity (omission), you might avoid a 100x opportunity. So, you'd rather have one optimistic take too many than one too few.  Link

Very good Coatue "public markets update". Their take on all of it can be summarized as: tokens >> tariffs. Link

Podcast with Bill Gurley on "the state of the private markets. Highly relevant for everyone investing in private tech companies. Link

Climate crisis tracker: The atmosphere is filling up with CO2. We must avoid a level of 450 parts per million. Current level: 430.6ppm (12 months ago: 427.3ppm, likely to exceed the target in 5-10 years).
Like this? Please subscribe here, and go ahead and share it with your friends. And if you have feedback, stories I've missed etc - send them to me on X or as a reply to this email!






This email was sent to <>
why did I get this?    unsubscribe from this list    update subscription preferences
Kjetil Holmefjord · Møllergata 34b · Oslo, Oslo 0179 · Norway
